intro: Bradleia obtusa, commonly known as the blunt bradleia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Bradleia obtusa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in swampy areas or along stream banks. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
